alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FAIRFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Baltimore, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Heath, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Millersport, Pleasantville, Fairfield Beach, Harbor Hills, Thornport, Thurston, Kirkersville, State Route 158 at State Route 204, Interstate 70 at State Route 37 and Interstate 70 at State Route 13. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 124 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
